segment.source: Capture and Apply Windows, System, and Recovery Partitions
segment.target: Capture and Apply Windows, System, and Recovery Partitions

segment.source: Capture and Apply Windows, System, and Recovery Partitions
segment.target: Capture and Apply Windows, System, and Recovery Partitions

segment.source: Capture and Apply Windows, System, and Recovery Partitions
segment.target: Capture and Apply Windows, System, and Recovery Partitions

segment.source: Capture a Windows image (.WIM) file and use it to deploy Windows to new devices.
segment.target: Capture a Windows image (.WIM) file and use it to deploy Windows to new devices.

segment.source: Rather than capturing each partition, you can capture just the Windows partition into an image, and then use the files from that image to set up the rest of the partitions on the drive.
segment.target: Rather than capturing each partition, you can capture just the Windows partition into an image, and then use the files from that image to set up the rest of the partitions on the drive.

segment.source: The following diagram illustrates this process:
segment.target: The following diagram illustrates this process:

segment.source: diagram showing capturing the windows partition
segment.target: diagram showing capturing the windows partition

segment.source: Prepare to capture the image
segment.target: Prepare to capture the image

segment.source: Generalize the Windows image, so it can be deployed to other devices.
segment.target: Generalize the Windows image, so it can be deployed to other devices.

segment.source: For more information, see Sysprep (Generalize) a Windows installation.
segment.target: For more information, see Sysprep (Generalize) a Windows installation.

segment.source: Capture the image
segment.target: Capture the image

segment.source: Boot the device using Windows PE.
segment.target: Boot the device using Windows PE.

segment.source: Applying the image
segment.target: Applying the image

segment.source: Here's a few ways to apply the image:
segment.target: Here's a few ways to apply the image:

segment.source: Apply the image manually
segment.target: Apply the image manually

segment.source: On the destination device, use a DiskPart script to configure and format your hard drive partitions.
segment.target: On the destination device, use a DiskPart script to configure and format your hard drive partitions.

segment.source: For more information, see Configure UEFI/GPT-Based Hard Drive Partitions or Configure BIOS/MBR-Based Hard Drive Partitions.
segment.target: For more information, see Configure UEFI/GPT-Based Hard Drive Partitions or Configure BIOS/MBR-Based Hard Drive Partitions.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you apply an image to a volume that has an existing Windows installation, files from the previous installation may not be deleted.
segment.target: If you apply an image to a volume that has an existing Windows installation, files from the previous installation may not be deleted.

segment.source: Format the volume by using a tool such as DiskPart before you apply the new image.
segment.target: Format the volume by using a tool such as DiskPart before you apply the new image.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: Where D: is a USB flash drive or other file storage location.
segment.target: Where D: is a USB flash drive or other file storage location.

segment.source: In these DiskPart examples, the partitions are assigned the letters: System=S, Windows=W, and Recovery=R.
segment.target: In these DiskPart examples, the partitions are assigned the letters: System=S, Windows=W, and Recovery=R.

segment.source: We recommend changing the Windows drive letter to a letter that’s near the end of the alphabet, such as W, to avoid drive letter conflicts.
segment.target: We recommend changing the Windows drive letter to a letter that’s near the end of the alphabet, such as W, to avoid drive letter conflicts.

segment.source: Do not use X, because this drive letter is reserved for Windows PE.
segment.target: Do not use X, because this drive letter is reserved for Windows PE.

segment.source: After the device reboots, the Windows partition is assigned the letter C, and the other partitions don’t receive drive letters.
segment.target: After the device reboots, the Windows partition is assigned the letter C, and the other partitions don’t receive drive letters.

segment.source: If you reboot, Windows PE reassigns disk letters alphabetically, starting with the letter C, without regard to the configuration in Windows Setup.
segment.target: If you reboot, Windows PE reassigns disk letters alphabetically, starting with the letter C, without regard to the configuration in Windows Setup.

segment.source: This configuration can change based on the presence of different drives, such as USB flash drives.
segment.target: This configuration can change based on the presence of different drives, such as USB flash drives.

segment.source: Optional: speed up the image capture by setting the power scheme to High performance:
segment.target: Optional: speed up the image capture by setting the power scheme to High performance:

segment.source: Apply the image to the Windows partition:
segment.target: Apply the image to the Windows partition:

segment.source: where W: is the Windows partition.
segment.target: where W: is the Windows partition.

segment.source: Configure the system partition by using the BCDBoot tool.
segment.target: Configure the system partition by using the BCDBoot tool.

segment.source: This tool copies and configures system partition files by using files from the Windows partition.
segment.target: This tool copies and configures system partition files by using files from the Windows partition.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: Copy the Windows Recovery Environment (RE) tools into the recovery tools partition.
segment.target: Copy the Windows Recovery Environment (RE) tools into the recovery tools partition.

segment.source: Where R: is the recovery partition
segment.target: Where R: is the recovery partition

segment.source: Register the location of the WindowsRE tools by using REAgentC.
segment.target: Register the location of the WindowsRE tools by using REAgentC.

segment.source: Apply the image using a script
segment.target: Apply the image using a script

segment.source: Prerequisite: Create DiskPart scripts to deploy your images.
segment.target: Prerequisite: Create DiskPart scripts to deploy your images.

segment.source: For samples, get: CreatePartitions-UEFI.txt or CreatePartitions-BIOS.txt.
segment.target: For samples, get: CreatePartitions-UEFI.txt or CreatePartitions-BIOS.txt.

segment.source: Copy the following script into Notepad, and then save the file as ApplyImage.bat:
segment.target: Copy the following script into Notepad, and then save the file as ApplyImage.bat:

segment.source: On the destination computer, run the Diskpart and ApplyImage scripts to apply the image to the computer and set up the system, Windows, and recovery partitions.
segment.target: On the destination computer, run the Diskpart and ApplyImage scripts to apply the image to the computer and set up the system, Windows, and recovery partitions.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: where D:ImagesThinImage.wim is the name of your Windows image file.
segment.target: where D:ImagesThinImage.wim is the name of your Windows image file.

segment.source: Note If the DISM /Apply-Image command fails, make sure you’re using a supported version of DISM for that Windows image.
segment.target: Note If the DISM /Apply-Image command fails, make sure you’re using a supported version of DISM for that Windows image.

segment.source: For example, to apply a Windows 10 image, you’ll need the Windows 10 version of DISM.
segment.target: For example, to apply a Windows 10 image, you’ll need the Windows 10 version of DISM.

segment.source: Capture and apply individual partitions (BIOS devices only)
segment.target: Capture and apply individual partitions (BIOS devices only)

segment.source: On your reference device, capture each of the partitions individually using DISM /Capture-Image and then apply them to your destination devices using DISM /Apply-Image.
segment.target: On your reference device, capture each of the partitions individually using DISM /Capture-Image and then apply them to your destination devices using DISM /Apply-Image.

segment.source: This method allows you flexibility in setting up your system partition.
segment.target: This method allows you flexibility in setting up your system partition.

segment.source: Note, for UEFI-based devices, do not capture and apply the EFI system partition or the MSR partition – these are managed by the device.
segment.target: Note, for UEFI-based devices, do not capture and apply the EFI system partition or the MSR partition – these are managed by the device.

segment.source: Use the BCDBoot command to set up the system partition.
segment.target: Use the BCDBoot command to set up the system partition.

segment.source: Capture and apply the entire drive
segment.target: Capture and apply the entire drive

segment.source: **** You can use the Full Flash Update (FFU) file format to capture and apply the entire drive.
segment.target: **** You can use the Full Flash Update (FFU) file format to capture and apply the entire drive.

segment.source: To learn more, see Deploy Windows using Full Flash Update (FFU).
segment.target: To learn more, see Deploy Windows using Full Flash Update (FFU).
